headline: Stuffed Peppers My Way
description: This rice-stuffed pepper recipe is made with roasted green bell peppers filled with a mixture of Arborio risotto, tomatoes, herbs, and feta cheese.

video.description: See how to make roasted green peppers stuffed with feta and rice.
video.name: Stuffed Peppers My Way

name: Stuffed Peppers My Way
recipeIngredient: 2 green bell peppers, halved and seeded

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in rice. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Meanwhile, place peppers cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet. Roast in the preheated oven until tender and skin begins to brown, 25 to 30 minutes.
While peppers are roasting, heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir onions, basil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper in oil for 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir in tomato and cook for 5 minutes. Spoon in cooked rice and stir until heated through.
Remove from heat, mix in feta cheese, and spoon mixture into pepper halves.
Return peppers to the oven until warmed through, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Loved it, I blanched my peppers for about three minutes. Added fresh garlic and a little onion.

We love this recipe but I did change it up a bit. Instead of using the rice, I use risotto and follow the recipe of that - adding butter, grated cheese to the mix. I also add 1 small can tomato sauce to the rice / hamburger mixture before stuffing. Also add extra sharp cheddar cheese to the mix - MMMMMMM.
Amazing every time. I use mozzarella and Ramano instead of the Feta. It's one that I have a lot of fun with, as well as being asked to make it often. End result makes me feel like a chef.
Why is the sodium and cholesterol content so high! Doesn't seem to make sense.

We really like this recipe for stuffed peppers, we have it every week or two. I used 1 1/2 cups water with the rice and it comes out a little more moist and doesn't stick to the pan so badly. Also when I don't have feta on hand I just use shredded mozzarella.
I added ground beef to mine since my better half has to have meat with his meals

I was looking for a meatless meal and this hit the spot. I liked the pre-baking of the peppers. I was skeptical about boiling the Arborio since I’ve only ever simmered it for Risotto. It worked great. I added a white onion to the rice mix and I double the recipe. Thanks for a yummy recipe.
This was amazing. Even my 20 month old grandson loved it. The only change I made was using canned diced tomatoes.
I used red and yellow peppers but otherwise followed the recipe.
I will try this recipe, but use whole grain brown rice which is healthier and more tasty than bland white rice
I absolutely loved it, I will add a little chilli next time ( we love chilli)
I love stuffed peppers!! I've stuffed so many different fillings in it, and I love fillings that are a bit untraditional, next up I'm stuffing tikka masala in a pepper, cannot wait!
This is amazing, I love stuffed peppers, and my way would be Indian tikka masala in a stuffed pepper!!!!

I like the recipe a lot. I took the advice of others and used a couple garlic cloves, and because we are vegan we added a meat substitute and vegan Violife feta cheese. I also used a couple poblano peppers along with some regular green peppers. The outcome was very good and we will make this again.
Really Delicious!!!!!!
I enjoyed it. I added one clove of garlic and some spinach.
As is I can’t give more than 3 stars. It seemed pretty dry. Next time I will be leaving the peppers whole and baking them standing up. I will also add crushed tomatoes to the rice mix for moisture.
Too high in sodium, skip the cheese

We liked this more than expected! I was looking for new vegetarian recipes so I took a chance on this and was very happy. I substituted a can of hot Rotel tomatoes for the fresh ones and added a can of dark red kidney beans. The feta cheese is the secret even though I don’t normally love that cheese. Delish!
Love the variation on an old favorite! Will be making again!

Delicious! I ended up using canned diced tomato because I didn’t have any fresh ones, and jasmine rice instead of Arborio, because that’s what I had on hand. I will make these again and again. Thanks for a great recipe!
Quick easy and delicious added a little ground beef and served with fresh zucchini . Loved the roasted peppers!

Excellent dish. Based on other reviewer comments, I baked the peppers in muffin tins and shortened the cook time to 15 mins. Cooked the rice in chicken stock and added fresh basil, mushrooms and garbanzo beans for a touch of protein to the tomato/green onion mixture along with and a splash of tomato sauce for additional moisture and flavor.
I make these all the time and I love them... thank you for sharing
This recipe has become a family favorite! I make it as is and double the recipe.

I adore this recipe. Our orange and yellow peppers worked perfectly. My only change was to saute some diced yellow onion and pepper trimmings along with the green onion/herb mixture. The result: a succulent side dish that we enjoyed over and over.

I followed this recipe except the cheese. My family who won't eat it normally, loved it. Thanks.
Making it again tonight.

I added scallions and diced tomatoes. Put shredded cheese in the middle of each. Baked for 30 covered and then added more scallions, tomatoes and finally shredded Sharp cheese to the top and baked for another ten minutes.
Very easy to make. Excellent flavor and only 3 things to wash! Definitely a keeper!

Great recipe! Big hit with everyone, including those eating the following day.

Modified with:
*Deletion of olive oil.

*Addition of 1lb cooked ground beef; finely chopped, sauteed zucchini and mushroom; and 1tsp tumeric paste. 

*Substituted tomato with 6oz of Italian tomato sauce; and Italian seasoning with oregano and a touch of rosemary.

*Only had feta brick, which I cubed. Crumbled is the way to go!
We used mini peppers and just mixed them into the stuffing mixture

Nice vegetarian meal that I will be making again! I used a can of drained diced tomatoes and garlic. Added some parmesan on top. I took the advise of another reviewer and used a muffin tin to "cup" my peppers as they flattened out during roasting. Something a little bigger would have been ideal so the pepper could fit all the way to the bottom, but I didn't have anything else. It worked though. It also helped to keep the peppers shaped like a cup after they were plated. Thanks for the recipe!
FOLLOWED RECIPE. VERY GOOD. WILL MAKE AGAIN.
I added a clove of minced garlic and one diced jalapeño for a little spice. It tasted great!
This was great - I made it with white onions and white rice since that's what was in the pantry.
I loved the recipe. Added diced zuchinni and black beans which were good. Will make again.
I used long grain rice (its what I had) and added the tomatoes in very last as I like them fresh, also added a little garlic powder and Tony's seasoning for a kick. They were very very good.

It's finally time I rate this recipe, because I have used it SO many times over the past few years. It's a staple and I love it. I use it as a 'base' recipe because there are a few key changes I make now that I love and wanted to share as an option. 

When the rice is cooking and the peppers are roasting, I start cooking 1lb of ground chicken, turkey or pork to a frying pan. When the meat is starting to brown but not cooked through, I add the green onions w spices, along with 2 chopped carrots, 1 chopped zucchini and 3 large chopped mushrooms (approximately; veggies are often whatever I have in the fridge). When the carrots are tender but not soft, I add the tomatoes and continue from there. This usually makes WAY more filling than the peppers can hold, but it's so good on its own, or as a filling for wraps, etc, and it also freezes well. 

Thanks for a great recipe!
It was delicious and have since made it many times
The peppers were very good.....however, every pan in my kitchen was used and the mess to clean up was not fun. My husband loved them but I doubt I will ever make them again.....
I made it and added corn, peas, yellow onions, and creole seasoning. Substituted white cheddar for the cheese. Delicious!
I added fresh chopped thyme and basil and a little sautéed ground beef and garlic. It was very tasty.

Loved by the whole family! We added a pound of ground turkey to the recipe so we used 4 peppers instead of just the two. I’m not a cooked pepper fan but having them cut in half and pre-roasted made them the perfect consistency - not too much pepper but a lot of filling. Delicious!

Loved this! Didn't have basil, used dried cilantro leaves. Used canned diced tomatoes with peppers and onion, drained. Also I added kidney beans for protein, salsa, and I seasoned my rice (minute rice) with veggie "better than bullion". Added a little parmesan cheese. Thought it lacked flavor & texture so topped it with pepper Jack cheese slices. Yum! You could probably add shredded chicken. Wish I'd had bigger green peppers. These were kinda small.
Loved it. However my spouse asked me to add hamburger or sausage next time.
My only change for making in the future will be the only roast the peppers for 15-20 minutes. They were alittle too soft. Other than that, this is a superb recipe!

I was short on time. So, I used another fast and easy stuffing. I decided to stuff my peppers with Knorr brand in an envelope Pasta Sides Fettuccine in Garlic and Asiago I was lazy and thought any green pepper stuffing would work. It was very tasty, however the next time I will follow this fantastic recipe.
Easy to make and somewhat tasty, but it needs a little more flavor. Sad to see some people adding ketchup to it!
I added more feta and a bit of tomato paste. Overall a very good, easy recipe.
I added fresh mushrooms into the mixture. I will definitely make this dish again!

This recipe was very good. I added 1/4 cup of chopped meat and used mild chedder cheese instead. I used a little more tomato since adding the meat. They were awesome. I also used red and yellow peppers to give it a different look.
Very good. Will make more often.
Made yesterday it was so good and so easy to make. I have shared the recipe with my daughters. LOVE IT
Made yesterday it was so good and so easy to make. I have shared the recipe with my daughters. LOVE IT

Excellent. Love it.
Thank you!

We made this last Sunday for dinner. Used basmati rice because that was what we had in the house. Used red peppers because we did not have green peppers, fresh basil and also put in one very large clove of garlic.
I tried the rice just before putting in the feta cheese and was not impressed but after putting the cheese....wow.
We plan to make this many times in the future, it was fantastic.

I love this recipe, is easy. 
I add It quinoa
Great recipe for meatless Mondays! I also made it with ground beef and just as good.
I made it with Quinoa instead of rice.Very good!
Yes I did I added meat cooked the rice added a bunch and sub a bunch not a veggie

I was looking for a side dish to make with lamb shanks and I had 3 yellow bell peppers. I didn't want to stuff the peppers with meat like usual since we were already having lamb. It was a big hit with the family and my stepson scarfed down all the leftovers. This one is going into my recipe vault. 

I did make a couple minor modifications. As stated I used Yellow peppers cause that is what I had on hand. I used Herb de Provence instead of Italian seasoning, but they are somewhat similar (again what I had). I used fresh basil because I had some leftover.
My family of 4 love this recipe!!
my wife & I really enjoy this recipe! for a healthier option we use Quinoa instead of rice and fresh diced tomatoes to eliminate the hugh sodium in canned tomatoes.
changed rice for cauliflower rice.... loved it

if you are going to add ground beef like I did, be sure to make a sauce for topping at the end as this dries out a bit. A tzatziki would be good with the beef, but for time reasons, i made a quick light tomato sauce in the same pan. Will be roasting peppers for any stuffed pepper I made going forward though! much better than boiling!!
I used Mexican Rice instead , added mushrooms & it was delicious.
Delicious, great for vegetarians !
I’ve made these peppers thousands of times! My dad is lactose intolerant so I substitute goat cheese for his peppers and he loves it. Sometimes I’ll half the salt and they still taste great!

These were great to use the day's harvest of peppers. I used Walla Walla onions instead of green, because that was also harvested, as was the tomato. I used leftover Cilantro Lime rice. Will make these again.

I made this for dinner last night. It was a last minute decision and this was easy to prepare quickly and I typically have everything the recipe calls for on hand. I sautéed the tomatoes and onions with the spices and added 1 clove minced garlic, a handful of black beans and about 1 cup of monterey jack cheese, and finally added the rice. I sautéed this for 20 minutes on very low heat. The flavors blended well together. It was a hit! My family loved this dish!
Added ground beef - thinking of adding black beans and more onion, possible corn next time
It was delicious. I actually added Itialian sausage becauze my boys just refuse to have vegetables and no meat.. Lol I loved the recipe!
Came out great , i added zucchini, onion and paprika and it was really good .
My husband LOVES when I make this! (I did augment it by adding browned ground pork to the rice mixture, and using three peppers instead of two, but everything is the same.) Yummy recipe!
Family really doesn’t like peppers, but this recipe was a winner! I plan to make this dinner again.
it was easy and tasted great, will be adding it to the rotation

Delicious! However, I did modify the recipe to include ground chicken, fennel, diced red onion and I substituted a can of petite diced tomatoes (including juice) for the fresh tomato. I garnished with the diagonal sliced green onion. Roasting the bell peppers makes a ton of difference. I will make this very frequently.
Delicious, nothing to change with this recipe, a good alternative to meat.

I made a few changes because I did not have the right cheese, I like garlic, I wanted wild and brown rice, and I wanted to add a little meat--I added chopped ham. But the spices made the difference. This is very versatile and I'll definitely make it again!
I substituted the rice with wild long grain rice and it was fantastic!
These were great! The perfect amount of everything, just like my mom used to make them.
It was a hit with my family , I will be making it again!

This recipe is a keeper. The only change I made was I added two cloves of thinly sliced fresh garlic - which I do to most meat and bland recipes because I like the flavor of garlic. This was the first time I had used Arborio Rice. Love the fluffy, light texture. I will find other uses for this rice
Love this easy recipe, I pair it with butter lemon shrimp yum!

I am not vegan so like to add meat to mine. I also have an adult child at home who doesnt like peppers. SOOOO, I make this into a casserole by cutting up multi-color peppers and mixing them right in with all of the other ingredients. Delish and solves for the fussy eater! I love the idea of using feta! Can't wait to try it it out!
I’ve made this many times and followed the recipe exactly. Both my husband and I love it. A great side dish.
Way too much sodium for me. Cut out the added salt because feta is already salted. Other than that very good, but my mother's is better.

I used to make this just like this, but it was difficult to eat as stuffed peppers. So now, I roast the peppers in chunks and we eat it more as a chunky pepper-tomato-rice salad. Tastes the same, just less messy to eat.
I enjoyed the video. It was really easy to follow

These came out awesome! I browned a package (a pound or so) of meatloaf mix (veal/pork/beef) right before adding the rice back in and it was so delicious. I made sure to double everything else aside from the rice though. I also had three smaller tomatoes so I used 3 instead of doubling. You can’t go wrong with this recipe, but if you’re like us, you need some additional protein!
Will certainly make it again. I doubled the recipe and had enough filling to stuff 5 peppers.

This was my first time making stuffed peppers and they turned out great! I don't eat beef, so this was a great alternative recipe. I used shallots instead of green onions and doubled the wonderful French feta that we had from 1/2 to 1 cup. My boyfriend said that he would've been really impressed even if he'd had this in a restaurant. A keeper, for sure.

Delish!! One of my fav recipes on this app!! I added 3 small cloves of garlic to the onion/spice mix and then some frozen corn to the tomatoes. I ignore the salt and pepper since there’s enough salt in the feta and the canned tomatoes I used. One of my roommates is lactose intolerant so I put the feta on top of two of the 4 peppers right before the final 5 minute roast in the oven and it’s a huge hit every time!!

This is a great recipe to bend to your will! It's good as it is, but it's flexible to add veggies you have around or change up spices or cheese to make it more appealing to your own personal taste. I liked it because it's easy to do, filling and no meat! 
Thank you for the recipe.
Delicious! Added some Jimmy Deans sausage and it was so flavorful.
I loved and my Dad would eat it again so that is high praise from him. I changed the cheese as Dad does not like feta, i used cheddar. I definitely will make again.
Delicious!

Loved this. I tweaked it a bit for my tastes but was honestly amazing and my husband LOVED it. It is super delicious, one of my new faves.. The arborio rice with it is amazing, don't use regular rice! I will make this again for sure. 

Here were my changes:

I used 3 peppers, one green and two red, so I adjusted water, olive oil, rice, and seasoning amounts accordingly. 

Dice 3/4 lg white onion instead of green onion
Add 3-4 cloves fresh garlic, then brown 
Remove 1/3 of the onion mixture
Brown pre-cooked mild Italian chicken sausage 
Dice a few mushrooms and add 
I only used one large diced tomato which was totally fine for me
Sub feta for 1/2 C Italian cheese blend + 1/4 C shredded Parmesan cheese
Place peppers in muffin tin to avoid collapse
I only had parmesan cheese and used just 1/4 cup. Still delicious!
